LEAD: Fred Grillo of Stonington, Conn., has announced September wedding plans for his daughter Kimberly Ann Grillo and David Hal Bernstein, the son of Diane Bernstein and Paul Bernstein, both of New York.
Fred Grillo of Stonington, Conn., has announced September wedding plans for his daughter Kimberly Ann Grillo and David Hal Bernstein, the son of Diane Bernstein and Paul Bernstein, both of New York.

Miss Grillo, 30 years old, and her fiance, 27, are lawyers. The prospective bride graduated cum laude from Central Connecticut State University and received a law degree from American University. She is an associate at the law firm of Kleban, Samor, Perles, Dardani, Silvestro & Saft in Southport, Conn. Her father is the president of K Builders in Stonington.

The prospective bridegroom, 27, is a clerk to Federal District Judge Robert E. Keeton in Boston and is to join the New York law firm of Debevoise & Plimpton as an associate in September. He is a magna cum laude graduate of Princeton University, where he was elected to Phi Beta Kappa, and has a master's degree in political philosophy from the London School of Economics and a law degree from Yale University.

Mr. Bernstein and his mother were admitted to the New York State Bar in April. His mother is an associate at the New York law firm of Phillips, Nizer, Benjamin, Krim & Ballon. His father is a senior vice president at Sanford C. Bernstein & Company, an investment research and money management concern in New York.
